title: ARiSe / CARE-CKD
subtitle: Retinal AI for cardiovascular screening in chronic kidney disease
summary: A frugal AI pipeline that repurposes routine retinal fundus images to estimate cardiovascular risk, designed for non-specialist and resource-limited settings.
highlights: Clinical validation on ~800 CKD patients; published in Kidney360 (CARE-CKD).
Demonstrated cross-disease utility (retinal feature pipeline applied to Alzheimer's detection).
Supported by Georgia Research Alliance (GRA) Phase 1 commercialization funding ($50,000).

title: Non-Invasive Transplant Rejection Monitoring
subtitle: ECG-based rejection risk estimation to reduce reliance on biopsies
summary: AI-based ECG modeling to estimate heart transplant rejection risk non-invasively and reduce frequent endomyocardial biopsies.
highlights: Preliminary validation accepted for presentation at ISHLT 2026.
Designed for integration into routine post-transplant clinical workflows.

title: Opportunistic Liver Screening (DeHFT / LARI)
subtitle: Hepatic steatosis assessment from low-dose CT originally acquired for coronary calcium scoring
summary: Deep learning and radiomics pipeline for liver fat/steatosis assessment from low-dose CT acquired for other indications (opportunistic screening).
highlights: Validated on ~700 patients with strong correlation to reference standards.
Underpins an allowed US patent on deep-learning-based hepatic fat assessment.
Extended to LARI study published in Lancet eBioMedicine.

title: STAR-Echo
subtitle: Spatiotemporal modeling of echocardiogram videos for MACE prognosis in CKD
summary: Spatiotemporal analysis of echocardiogram videos to derive prognostic signatures for major adverse cardiovascular events (MACE) in CKD.
highlights: Associated transformer-based spatiotemporal patent application (US 20250118435 A1).

title: Graduate Student Advocacy Board (GSAB) Leadership
subtitle: Co-President, BME (Georgia Tech/Emory)
summary: Student leadership focused on improving PhD training experience, mentoring, and addressing TA/health insurance concerns.
highlights: Organized student-faculty townhalls on PhD training concerns.
Helped restart Mock Quals mentorship pairing senior and junior PhD students.
Created avenues to discuss TA and health insurance concerns.
